summary: So, in honor of the Good Omens trailer dropping, I’d like to reccomend my two favorite Good Omens continuation stories: The...
body:
So, in honor of the Good Omens trailer dropping, I’d like to reccomend my two favorite Good Omens continuation stories:

The Manchester Lost/Paradise Thwarted (on fanfiction.net) duo is the more comedic of the picks, and is a completed universe. Manchester Lost deals with God and Satan trying for another Apocalpse, Aziraphale gets kidnapped by hell, and Crowley teams up with the Archangels (aka Aziraphale’s adopted dad and uncles) to save him and avert the second Apocalypse. Paradise Thwarted is the sequel where Adam’s untimely death after becoming Prime Minister returns humanity’s memories of both Apocalpyses, and now it’s Heaven and Hell vs. Humanity. Kind of. The demon can’t seem to keep their shit together and the new antichrist isn’t helping.

This set is full of masterful comedy and crack whenever it suits it, and enjoys making fun of the sillier side of fandoms (fangirl hell is eternal shipwars). The Archangel Michael is utterly hilarious and more than a little in the wrong genre (he think’s he’s the star of a heroic epic). In the end, God really just wants everyone to be happy, and He’s hoping to make that happen…eventually. An interesting happy ending is in store.

Then there’s Gray Areas (on AO3), a much longer but sadly unfinished series. This also deals with the aftermath of Good Omens, but it a bit of trip to read after/alongside the former fics because of the very different characterizations of Lucifer, God, Beelzebub, and Michael. And Hell itself. 

Gray Areas deals with Aziraphale and Crowley being made free agents after thwarting the Apocalypse, and the blurring of lines between angels and demons and humans start to prove themselves as more of a threat than expected. We gets a secondary relationship between Michael and Beelzebub later on. God and Lucifer are almost never named (bar one scene with Beel and Luci) but there’s tons of scenes with them interacting where it’s only sometimes made clear which is which, since they’re in disguises.

This series has more explicit sexual content (the bulk of the stories are rated M, either for violence or the sex) but it’s all generally plot-important and pretty well-written. Aziaphale and Crowley dealing with the fallout of their choices while God and Lucifer play a game behind the scenes, preparing for something unknown that only starts becoming clear before the series stopped being written. It’s all still very good and worth reading for the well-written relationships and humor.

title: Good Omens - First Trailer
body:
#GoodOmens - First Trailer released! #TheEndisNigh (in 2019)

Amazon released the first full trailer for Good Omens this past weekend at the New York Comic Con (NYCC) in New York City:

Described as equal parts humor and horror, fantasy and drama, Good Omens takes place in 2018 when the Apocalypse is near and Final Judgment is set to descend upon humanity. The armies of Good and Evil are…

View On WordPress

summary: #adopt the antichrist challenge...Aziraphale: “when he’s displaying demonic tendencies he’s your son” Crowley: “he’s always...
question: #adopt the antichrist challenge...Aziraphale: “when he’s displaying demonic tendencies he’s your son” Crowley: “he’s always displaying demonic tendencies! He’s the devils son!” ...Aziraphale: “he’s my son!” Crowley: “good, then you can deal with him then”

title: Fic: Be Ye Therefore Merciful
excerpt: Title: Be Ye Therefore Merciful Rating: PG-13 for violence Characters: Aziraphale, Crowley, Death Pairing: A/C vaguely hinted at Notes: Okay, I'm reeeeeeally not sure about this one, but it's been sitting on my hard drive for some time now and I finally came up with an ending, so. I was…
description:
THIS IS HIGHLY IRREGULAR.

“Er, yes. I’m aware of that,” Aziraphale said, inordinately pleased at how lacking in panic his own voice sounded. “I am sorry to inconvenience you. I know you must be dreadfully busy, but I’m afraid I simply can’t allow it.”

YOU’RE OBSTRUCTING THE DUTIES OF A DULY APPOINTED REPRESENTATIVE OF THE MOST HIGH.

Aziraphale swallowed audibly. “Yes. I-I suppose I am.”

CONSORTING WITH THE ADVERSARY, IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF HEAVENLY LAW.

“I wouldn’t call it consorting, exactly…”

YOU ARE, IN FACT, RUNNING AMOK.

Look I figure we’re going to get a boat full of Aziraphale/Crowley in 2019 so in anticipation of this here is a great starter fic.
